metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0135 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds write issue was found in the VirGL virtual OpenGL renderer (virglrenderer). This flaw allows a malicious guest to create a specially crafted virgil resource and then issue a VIRTGPU_EXECBUFFER ioctl, leading to a denial of service or possible code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirglrenderer1 - 0.9.1-1~exp1ubuntu2
virgl-server - 0.9.1-1~exp1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virglrenderer package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.1-1~exp1ubuntu2').
